question: I currently have Medical Assistance coverage; why is this change in continuous coverage happening?
text:
I currently have Medical Assistance coverage; why is this change in continuous coverage happening? 
          
        
In March 2020, the federal government allowed states to keep Medicaid and CHIP coverage open regardless of eligibility as part of COVID-19 pandemic relief. Pennsylvania continued to send annual renewal packets during this time, but most people did not lose coverage for changes in income or for not completing their renewal.


A federal law passed in December 2022 ends continuous coverage on April 2, 2023.As of April 1, 2023, DHS must end MA and/or CHIP coverage if a person does not complete their renewal or if they have income or other changes that make them ineligible for MA or CHIP at the time of their renewal.
